general_advisory: After harvesting of paddy, it is ideal time for land preparation for sowing of pulses like green gram & black gram. To prevent damage from fog, low temperature and moisture stress, provide light irrigation to standing crops & vegetables during morning hours.

advisory: For optimum growth & vigor of seedling, apply plant growth promoting substances like humic acid & seaweed extract @1ml/litre of water.
Nursery treatment with Fipronil 0.3 G @100g/1 cent nursery area 7 days before transplanting to reduce infestation level of stem borer.
Rice grains must be dried under the sun for 3-4 days to 14% moisture for consumption and 12% moisture for seed purpose.
Make the threshing floor and storage godown clean and spray Lambda Cyahalothrin 4.9CS@ 1.5ml/li. of water to minimize the chance of future infestation of storage pests.
After harvesting of paddy, it is the ideal time for land preparation for sowing pulses like green gram, black gram.
To protect the crop from whitefly and other sucking pests in the early stages mix Imidacloprid 600 FS @5 ml per 1 kg of seeds before sowing.
Sow the seeds after treating with (Carboxin + Thiram)@2gm/kg of seed before 7 days.
After harvesting of paddy, it is the ideal time for land preparation for sowing pulses like green gram, black gram.
To protect the crop from whitefly and other sucking pests in the early stages mix Imidacloprid 600 FS @5 ml per 1 kg of seeds before sowing.
Sow the seeds after treating with (Carboxin + Thiram)@2gm/kg of seed before 7 days.
Monitor the infestation of Aphid, Tobacco caterpillar, Cabbage webber & incidence of alternaria leaf spot disease in mustard.
To control aphid in mustard apply flonicamid Mustard 50WG@ 60g/acre.
Irrigate the field if soil moisture stress is observed.
Monitor the infestation of Aphid, Tobacco caterpillar, Cabbage webber & incidence of alternaria leaf spot disease in mustard.
To control aphid in mustard apply flonicamid Mustard 50WG@ 60g/acre.
Irrigate the field if soil moisture stress is observed.
Spraying of Rhidomil M-Z @2g/li of water to prevent the spread of collar rot & early leaf blight disease in groundnut.
To control leaf-eating caterpillar and fruit borer in winter vegetables like Brinjal, Cole crops, Chilly & tomato apply 0.5 g Emamectin benzoate or Spinosad 0.4 ml/liter of water.

Cauliflower: If tobacco caterpillar infestation in cauliflower observed, spray Azadiractin 5% W/W @ 0.5 ml/litre of water or Emamectin benzoate 5% SG @ 0.5 g/litre of water is recommended. To manage Alternaria leaf spot disease in Cole crops spray Mancozeb 75% WP @ 600-gram/acre or (carbendazim 12% + Mancozeb 63%) WP @ 400-gram/acre by mixing in 200-litre of water.
Banana - Apply (Carbendazim + Mancozeb) @ 2g/liter of water to reduce the incidence of Sigatoka leaf spot disease in banana.
